page.title: 09A rural Church in Cumbria
page.content:
St Mary's Church, Sebergham, is 800 years old. There are 66 names on the electoral role and congregations vary between 10 and 100 at the Harvest Festival. The Vicar is shared with the adjoining parishes of Caldbeck and Castle Sowerby; he conducts only one Service each month. Another Service is held by the parishoners themselves if no Lay Reader is available.
Money is raised by collections and by covenants given by the parishoners on which the Church, being a charity, can reclaim tax. Special fund raising events include dances, domino drives and sales of work.
Money is spent on maintaining and heating the church and on the annual diocesan quota.
